tasks.title: Create CSS foundation with dark/light theming and glassmorphism
tasks.description: Create docs/assets/css/custom.css with CSS custom properties for dark (default) and light themes, glassmorphism card styles (.glass-card with backdrop-filter blur, semi-transparent borders), scroll animation classes (.fade-in to .fade-in.visible), pipeline visualization layout (horizontal desktop, vertical mobile), code block styling with copy button positioning, responsive breakpoints, and transition utilities. Dark palette: navy #0f172a bg, purple #7c3aed accent, green #22c55e accent. Light palette: white/light gray bg with adjusted accents. Include Tailwind dark: class strategy support (darkMode class on html element).

verification.command: test -s docs/assets/css/custom.css && echo 'CSS exists and non-empty'

tasks.context:
## Spec Context
Dark-first design: Dark navy background (#0f172a or similar). Light mode: Clean white/light gray, toggle via sun/moon icon. Accent colors: Purple (#7c3aed) and toxic green (#22c55e). Glassmorphism: Frosted panels with backdrop-filter: blur(), semi-transparent borders. Scroll animations: Staggered fade-in on section entry (IntersectionObserver). Code blocks: Dark background with syntax-style coloring, copy button.

## Dependencies
None — foundation task.

## Key Requirements
- CSS variables for both themes
- .glass-card class with backdrop-filter: blur(12px)
- .fade-in / .fade-in.visible for scroll animations
- .pipeline class responsive horizontal to vertical
- No FOUC: inline critical dark mode styles or preload
- Gradient text utility for hero headline

tasks.title: Build HTML landing page with all 9 sections
tasks.description: Create docs/index.html — the complete single-page landing site. Includes: (1) SEO meta tags + Open Graph tags (canonical: zerg-ai.com), (2) Tailwind Play CDN pinned to v3.4.17 with darkMode class config, (3) custom.css link, (4) Sticky nav with logo, section links (Why, How, Commands, Quick Start, FAQ), dark/light toggle icon, prominent GitHub link (icon + text), mobile hamburger, (5) Hero with commanding Zerg-themed headline, gradient text, subheadline, pip install CTA with copy button, 4 glass pillar cards (Secure by Default, Run Anywhere, Massively Parallel, Token Smart), (6) Why ZERG with 4 pain-to-solution pairs, (7) How It Works pipeline (Plan to Design to Rush to Merge) horizontal on desktop/vertical on mobile, (8) Commands cheat sheet table with all 26 /zerg:* commands grouped by category, link to wiki, (9) Quick Start 4-step code block with copy button, (10) Stats section with 3 counter cards (26 commands, 3 exec modes, 30-50% token savings), (11) FAQ accordion with 6 Q&A pairs using details/summary, (12) Footer with GitHub, Wiki, Sponsor, License links and attribution. All sections use .fade-in class for scroll animations. Tailwind utility classes for layout. References custom.css for theming and main.js (deferred script) for interactivity.

verification.command: python3 -c "from html.parser import HTMLParser; HTMLParser().feed(open('docs/index.html').read()); print('Valid HTML')" && test $(grep -c '/zerg:' docs/index.html) -ge 26 && echo 'All 26 commands present'

tasks.context:
## Spec Context
Sections: (1) Sticky nav bar — fixed top, semi-transparent + backdrop blur, logo + wordmark left, section anchors center, dark/light toggle + GitHub link right, hamburger on mobile. (2) Hero — playful Zerg-themed headline, gradient text, subheadline explaining ZERG, pip install CTA with copy button, 4 glass pillar cards. (3) Why ZERG — 4 bullet pairs pain-to-solution. (4) How It Works — Plan-Design-Rush-Merge pipeline, horizontal desktop, vertical mobile. (5) Commands — all 26 commands in table, grouped by category. (6) Quick Start — 4-step code block. (7) Stats — animated counters. (8) FAQ — details/summary accordion. (9) Footer.

Visual: Dark navy #0f172a, purple #7c3aed, green #22c55e accents. Glassmorphism cards. Gradient headline text. System font stack, monospace for code.

The 26 commands: brainstorm, design, init, plan, rush, cleanup, logs, merge, retry, status, stop, analyze, build, refactor, review, security, test, create-command, debug, git, plugins, worker, document, estimate, explain, index, select-tool.

Canonical URL: https://zerg-ai.com (future domain). OG URL should use this.

## Implementation Notes (from issue validation)
- HERO HEADLINE: Issue #206 suggests: 'The only Claude Code orchestrator that auto-secures, containerizes, and parallelizes your entire feature.' Use this or a close variant incorporating the swarm metaphor.
- LICENSE: Footer must say 'Apache 2.0' (NOT MIT). The repo license is Apache 2.0.
- LAZY LOADING: Add loading='lazy' to all images below the fold (logo in nav can be eager, everything else lazy). Required for <2s load target per #209.

## Dependencies
TASK-001 creates custom.css with .glass-card, .fade-in, theme variables.
TASK-002 creates optimized logo at docs/assets/img/zerg-logo-web.png and OG image.

tasks.title: Implement JavaScript interactivity
tasks.description: Create docs/assets/js/main.js as single IIFE with all interactive features: (1) Dark/light mode toggle — read localStorage('theme'), apply .dark class to html, toggle sun/moon icon, persist choice. Default to dark. Respect prefers-color-scheme on first visit. (2) Mobile hamburger menu — toggle nav link visibility on small screens. (3) Copy-to-clipboard — find all .copy-btn elements, use navigator.clipboard.writeText with fallback to textarea method, show 'Copied!' feedback. (4) FAQ accordion — enhance native details/summary with smooth height animation using CSS transitions. (5) Scroll animations — IntersectionObserver on all .fade-in elements, add .visible when entering viewport with staggered delays. (6) Stat counter animation — when stats section enters viewport, animate numbers from 0 to target using requestAnimationFrame. (7) Smooth scroll — intercept anchor clicks, scrollTo with offset for sticky nav height. (8) Active nav highlighting — IntersectionObserver on sections, highlight corresponding nav link.
tasks.context:
## Spec Context
Interactivity requirements: Dark/light toggle persists via localStorage. Copy-to-clipboard on code blocks. FAQ accordion smooth expand/collapse. Scroll animations staggered fade-in. Stat counters animate on scroll. Mobile hamburger menu. Active nav highlighting.

Graceful degradation: Content must be readable with JS disabled. details/summary works natively. Dark mode defaults without JS (class='dark' on html). Copy buttons hidden without JS.

## Implementation Notes (from issue validation)
- FAQ CHEVRON: Add chevron/arrow icon rotation animation on FAQ expand/collapse (per #208). Rotate 90deg or 180deg when details is open. Use CSS transition on a chevron span/svg inside each summary element.
- SCROLL ANIMATIONS: Include subtle scale-up (e.g. transform: scale(1.02)) on glass pillar cards when entering viewport, in addition to the standard fade-in (per #209).

## Dependencies
TASK-003 creates index.html with DOM structure: .copy-btn buttons, .fade-in sections, details/summary FAQ, nav with anchors, #stats with data-target attributes, mobile menu button.

## Security (JavaScript)
- No dynamic code execution
- No innerHTML with user input (static content only)
- navigator.clipboard API (secure context only)
- No external script dependencies
- IIFE to avoid global scope pollution

tasks.title: Update deployment workflow and remove MkDocs
tasks.description: Modify .github/workflows/docs.yml to: (1) Remove python setup step, (2) Remove pip install mkdocs-material step, (3) Remove mkdocs build step, (4) Change upload-pages-artifact path from site/ to docs/, (5) Add docs.yml itself to path triggers, (6) Keep existing deploy job unchanged. Also delete docs/index.md (replaced by index.html) and delete mkdocs.yml (no longer needed). Verify the workflow YAML is valid.

verification.command: python3 -c "import yaml; yaml.safe_load(open('.github/workflows/docs.yml')); print('Valid YAML')" && ! test -f mkdocs.yml && ! test -f docs/index.md && echo 'Workflow updated, MkDocs removed'

tasks.context:
## Spec Context
Deployment: Repurpose .github/workflows/docs.yml. Change build step: replace mkdocs build with simple file copy/upload of docs/. Update path triggers to include docs/**. Remove mkdocs.yml trigger. Upload docs/ as pages artifact instead of site/.

MkDocs removal: Delete mkdocs.yml. Delete docs/index.md (replaced by index.html). Keep all other .md docs files.

## Current Workflow
Current docs.yml: checkout, setup-python, pip install mkdocs-material, mkdocs build --strict --clean, upload site/, deploy.
New: checkout, upload docs/, deploy. Much simpler.

## Dependencies
TASK-003 creates docs/index.html which replaces docs/index.md as the landing page.
